title: Clingmans Dome Observation Tower closed for repairs
content: ASHEVILLE, N.C. (WJHL) - A popular location to view the Great Smoky Mountains National Park will be closed for a portion of June.   According to a park official the Clingmans Dome Observation Tower will be closed beginning Monday for the completion of a rehabilitation project which began last year is completed. It is scheduled to remain closed through June 15.   Spokeswoman Dana Soehn says the work is weather dependent. Soehn said workers need five days of dry weather to complete the work and if that happens, work may go faster and the tower may open sooner.   At 6,643 feet, the observation tower provides a sweeping view of the park.   The parking overlook at the observation tower will remain open as well as the visitor contact station and store.
